docs.snippet: Posts that are flagged will be reviewed by the social network, which will provide resources to the concerned friend and offer help to the person at risk.

headline.main: Facebook Offers Tools for Those Who Fear a Friend May Be Suicidal

docs.abstract: Facebook introduces features that will allow social media service's users to more easily aid friends who make statements about suicide or self-harm; change is largest step taken by major technology company to include suicide prevention tools in platform, and comes at time when suicide rates in United States have reached 30-year high.

headline.print_headline: The Corrosive Election and the New Abnormal
headline.main: The Corrosive Election and the New Abnormal

docs.snippet: The Internet giant must do a better job of enforcing its gun sale ban.
docs.abstract: Editorial warns Facebook is being used to circumvent domestic gun laws and as way to facilitate international arms trade; calls on company to take necessary steps to halt practice both internationally and domestically.

headline.print_headline: How You’re Making Facebook a Money Machine

Accused of political bias, the company offered details on how human editors and algorithms choose what appears — or doesn’t appear — in “Trending Topics.”

headline.print_headline: Facebook Publishes Guidelines on the News
headline.main: Facebook, Facing Bias Claims, Shows How Editors and Algorithms Guide News

docs.abstract: Facebook publishes its internal editorial guidelines as part of social media network's latest effort to confront accusations it is politically biased against conservative publications; guidelines show how both editors and algorithms play roles in news selection.

docs.snippet: Facebook is blocking ad blockers on the desktop version of its service, saying well-made, relevant ads can be "useful."

headline.print_headline: Facebook Hates Ad Blockers So Much It Now Blocks Them
headline.main: Facebook Hates Ad Blockers So Much It Now Blocks Them
